content.title: Financial Assistance as Shagun in Marriage of Man Workers or Son of Workers - Haryana Labour Welfare Board
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance as Shagun in Marriage of Man Workers or Son of Workers' was started by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB) on 15.01.2019. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- will be provided as Shagun for the marriage of workers' sons and unmarried male workers themselves. The benefit of the scheme will help reduce the financial pressure on workers during their own marriage or their son's marriage.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for the marriage of workers' sons and unmarried male workers.
eligibility: The applicant should be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
The applicant should be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
The monthly salary of the applicant should not exceed ₹25,000/-.
The applicant must have a minimum of three years of regular membership of the Board till the marriage date.
The applicant should apply within six months after the marriage date.
The benefits are provided to workers for the marriage of up to two sons and for the self-marriage of male workers.
documents_required: Employee Certificate/ID proof of the worker issued by the organization
Marriage Registration Certificate/ Establishment undertaking (Before marriage)

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched on January 15, 2019.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹21,000/-.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: To be eligible, the applicant must be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana, registered with the HLWB, have a monthly salary not exceeding ₹25,000/-, and have at least three years of regular membership with the Board until the marriage date.

faqs.question: What is the maximum salary limit for eligibility under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant’s monthly salary should not exceed ₹25,000/-.

faqs.question: How long must an applicant be a member of the Board to qualify?
faqs.answer: The applicant must have a minimum of three years of regular membership with the Board until the marriage date.

faqs.question: Can this scheme be availed for the marriage of daughters?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for the marriage of workers' sons and unmarried male workers themselves.

faqs.question: How many times can a worker avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: A worker can avail of the benefit for the marriage of up to two sons and for the self-marriage of unmarried male workers.

faqs.question: Is there a time limit for applying for the benefit after the marriage date?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application must be submitted within six months after the marriage date.

faqs.question: Can the benefit be applied for before the marriage date?
faqs.answer: Yes, the benefit can be applied for three days before the marriage date, but the organization must certify the date and maintain necessary documents.

faqs.question: How does a worker register with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: A worker can register by visiting the official website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: To apply for the benefits, the applicant must visit the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
